newsitem.title: USA: Zenith Internet product plans lift stock.
newsitem.headline: Zenith Internet product plans lift stock.

text.p: Zenith Electronics Corp's plans to introduce Internet television products through two new alliances gave its stock a boost Wednesday, analysts said.
"It's favorable news ... and fits in with Zenith's production of settop (decoder) boxes," one analyst said.

Ahead of the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, Zenith said it is teaming up with Network Computer Inc, a unit of Oracle Corp, and with Navio Communications Inc, an affiliate of Netscape Communications Corp.
Zenith, which makes television and video products, was trading at 11-7/8, up 3/4.

George Podrasky of Duff and Phelps Credit Rating Co said while the new NetVision products, to be introduced later in 1997, are "potentially positive, it remains to be seen what the consumer really wants."

Analyst Robert Gutenstein of Kalb, Voohris agrees. "If the consumer should choose to put Internet on his TV, Zenith will be in a good position." He noted that competing consumer electronics companies have moved in a similar direction.

Gutenstein added that the latest alliances appear to be a replacement for Zenith's original plan announced last spring to produce an Internet-linked television product with Diba Inc of Menlo Park, Calif. "That has yet to be delivered," he said.
